- Introduce a new patient rights guarantee that strengthens a patient's legal status and provides them the opportunity to choose between healthcare providers across the country

policy_stances.issue_stance: International studies have shown that Sweden is lagging behind on core subjects.  Within primary and secondary schools, there is no clear educational focus or opportunities for students to develop at their own pace.  More tools are needed to solve the problems in our education system and that there should be good career paths for teachers.  In addition, there needs to be effective school health and study guidance, and that teachers should be relieved from administrative work.  The Swedish Democrats' education policy is party based on a return to what worked well before, party based on inspiration from other countries that are doing well today.
policy_wants: - Allow teachers to resolve the problems by allowing them to report on students who need special supervision and allowing them to intervene when students commit serious abuse
- Create attractive career paths for teachers with better payrolls
- Create financial incentives for educational choice as demanded by the labor market and creating labor market balance by getting more people to choose vocational education

policy_stances.issue_stance: Swedish nature is a rich and valuable treasure that must be protected and preserved.  We emphasize that there should be a managerial spirit that promotes active agriculture and forestry in parallel with work that preserves untouched nature.  Sweden's greenhouse gase emissions are the lowest of any industrialized country.  The Sweden Democrats' environmental policy is constructive, realistic and based on how we can combat global environmental pollution and greenhouse gases globally in a cost-effective way that does not negatively impact our rural and industrial areas.
policy_wants: - Support safe and efficient nuclear power through research and development of fourth generation reactors
- Work against eutrophication in lakes, streams and seas, clean up tens of thousands of polluted areas found around Sweden
- Promote the electrification of the transport sector through ivestments on infrastructure with more charging posts and a hydrogen strategy
- Focus on energy efficiency and energy research

policy_stances.issue_stance: The elderly deserve to get the world's best care.  We cannot accept that there are some who die alone, their lives ending in social isolation, or that people feel strongly worried about getting old due to the lack of care and poorer pension conditions.  All people should be able to age with dignity.  When someone is struggling, society should be there to come in and provide the help that they need so that the elderly can continue to live a safe and meaningful life.  Older people should be able to stay in their homes, even if that means care costs increase.  No one should be forced away from their friends, relatives and pets other than in cases of necessity like hospital care.
policy_wants: - Increase the housing allowance and guarantee pensions, cancel the pension tax
- Establish a mandatory 24-hour crew at retiremnt homes and discontinue the involuntary shared hours for staff
- Introduce food reform with minimum requirements for freshly prepared, tasty and nutritious foods

- Introduce elderly care centers to improve efficiency in elderly care, establish a fast track policy in emergency care to improve health and to provide an elderly specialist.  Offer free elderly care for people aged 85 years or older and increase dental care
- Provide a tax reduction and a statutory right to work part-time for the elderly who remain in the labor market

policy_stances.issue_stance: The problems in the Swedish labor market today are complex, and education and employment levels diffir strongly between groups.  The Swedish Democrats seek an active but clearly defined labor market policy.  We want a pragmatic, cross-political attitude with the aim of safeguarding the nation's overall interests.  This means that we do not subscribe to either right or left politics.  Instead, our policy is based on a target image that is based on labor market balance, support in times of unemployment, improved conditons for small and medium-sized enterprises, safe workplaces and cost-effective matching.
policy_wants: - Abolish ineffective labor market measures such as New Start Jobs, Establishment Jobs and Introductory Jobs, and instead focus on small businesses through expanded start-up funds, reduced sick pay, reduced employer fees and a more comprehensive industrial strategy
- Improve conditions in the public sector such as a right to full-time
- Abolish employment services in its current form, open up to a wide range of actors and establish an agency for oversight and effectivenss assessments on private employment agencies

policy_stances.issue_stance: The state of safety in our country is not good.  Women, children and the elderly are too afraid to go out alone in the evening.  There are street fights between rival suburbs and police support is unclear.  Current and past governments have seriously damaged public confidence in the judiciary.  Police officers are resigning as a result of poor working conditions and growing threats.  Fire brigades and ambulances cannot enter immigrant neighborhoods without an armed escort.  Sweden Democrats want a Sweden where people can feel safe - no matter what time of the day and regardless of location.  We want a country based on loyalty, solidarity and trust towards each other, where the public place is not taken over by criminals.  We want a society where victims of crime receive support and where perpetrators receive a punishment in proportion to the seriousness of their crime.
policy_wants: - The state will guarantee the damges made to victims and then claim that amount from the perpetrator
- Introduce mandatory expulsion for gross crimes committed by foreigners and introduce the possibility of revoking one's citizenship in cases of terrorist offences
- Make it more attractive to become a police officer through increased funding for the police service, increased wages and more career paths
- Make it safer for police officers on duty through increasing penalties for assaulting an officer.  Facilitate the use of police surveillance cameras
- Greatly increase the number of police officers
- Introduce broad penalties and raise the minimum punishment for repeated and serious crime, cross-border crime, weapons smuggling, and introduce life sentences for particularly dangerous offenders

policy_stances.issue_stance: We think Swedish welfare should prioritize Swedish citizens.  Medical care should be available throughout our country, regardless of the size of one's wallet.  We want to provide healthcare staff with an improved work environment, good development opportunities and a good salary level.  We want a school that prioritizes knowledge and order.  In our Sweden, older people should get a pension that they can live on.

The tax system has to be simplified, transparent and easier to understand with less complicated special rules.  Comprehensive rules such as those few companies' corporate tax rules should be discontinued.  Fairer and simpler rules can also be achieved through increased harmonization of tax rates on different tax bases.  Swedish taxpayers should feel motivated to pay taxes, because welfare and security should live up to our expectations, and that work should always be taxed reasonably.

The Sweden Democrats want to make huge tax cuts for wage earners and small businesses while proposing extensive support for those who are most vulnerable, such as tax cuts for retirees, strengthened pensions, along with incresaed cash and housing allowances.  Our starting point is to take responsibility for public finances and implement financial reforms as the need arises.  Savings can also be ensured by stopping the increased costs associated with excessive immigration.
